ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Has man ever known a point of time when he was not something remembered?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: WAS THERE NOT a time in the life of man when he was not even a mentionable thing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There was certainly a time when there was no mention of the human being.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed there has been a time for man, when even his name did not exist anywhere.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Has there not been over man a period of time, when he was not a thing worth mentioning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: There surely came over man a period of time when he was a thing not worth mentioning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Has there come on man a while of time when he was a thing unremembered?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hath there come upon man (ever) any period of time in which he was a thing unremembered?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Was there not a period of time when man was nothing worth mentioning?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Surely there hath come upon man a space of time when he was not a thing worth mentioning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Has there been a period of time for man when he was not anything worthy of mention?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Has there not been over Man a long period of Time, when he was nothing - (not even) mentioned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Has there not been over man a period of time, when he was nothing to be mentioned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, there came upon the human a period of time when he was an unremembered thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Has there come upon man a period of time when he was nothing to be mentioned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:1] Has there [ever] been — there has indeed [been] — for man, Adam, a period of time, forty years, in which he was a thing unmentioned? — he was during this [period] a fashioned in clay and not mentioned; alternatively what is meant by insān, ‘man’, is the generic noun and by hīn, ‘a period of time’, the period of gestation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Hath there come upon man (ever)): '(Hath there come upon man (ever)) there has come upon Adam (any period of time) a period of 40 years when he was created and fashioned (in which he was a thing unremembered?) not knowing who he was, what his name was or what Allah wanted from him.
